channel.title: 30GB of RAM good? (*Please move to General Questions*)!
channel.description:
Hey, I have 30GB of RAM on my Notebook Compaq but im kind of confused because whenever i try to run my COD5 game or Fallout 3 game it still lags a lot. Is 30GB of RAM good for these games? lol, i would think it is.
How much RAM does everyone else use to run big games?

item.title: 30GB of RAM good? (*Please move to General Questions*)!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Arcik:

Could I get a 8GB USB for $5 on ebay and use it as ram?

Yes but it most cases it just reduces performance. The USB 3.0 interface is reasonably fast, but still nowhere near the speed data can be written and accessed with RAM. You also have to consider that most flash memory chips (especially in a cheap $5 usb stick) is incredibly slow so the performance is even worse. Your internal drive will dictate a much greater throughput so if you want “free ram” just dedicate more space to your swap partition or page file. Having said that, virtual memory is still dog slow and if you really need more memory, just get your hands on actual physical sticks of it

Read full topic
item.source: 30GB of RAM good? (*Please move to General Questions*)!

item.title: 30GB of RAM good? (*Please move to General Questions*)!
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:26, topic:521864”][quote author=Travas link=topic=640375.msg4315947#msg4315947 date=1371491308]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=640375.msg4315932#msg4315932 date=1371490149]

[quote author=Travas link=topic=640375.msg4315306#msg4315306 date=1371399853]

[quote author=Arcik link=topic=640375.msg4315271#msg4315271 date=1371395204]
I though windows only support up to 16gb anyway?
[/quote]nope. It can support A LOT. 32 bit supports very little physical memory and 64 bit supports a ton more (of course, older windows operating systems support less, but windows 8 nowadays supports a lot).
[/quote]I believe the max supported ram(without getting a server board…) is 64gb in windows 8?
[/quote]What does a server board have to do with anything, I am talking about windows 8 in general.

I suggest you look at this http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa366778(v=vs.85).aspx
[/quote]a blade server can hold much more than windows 8 that’s what I am getting at. A regular consumer motherboard would only maximize out at 64gb at the current time ( correct me if I am wrong but I do not believe there is a 128gb motherboard for a regular OS…?)[/quote]actually there is lol, but actually needing that much or ever using that much is a totally different story.

Read full topic
item.source: 30GB of RAM good? (*Please move to General Questions*)!

item.title: 30GB of RAM good? (*Please move to General Questions*)!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:25, topic:521864”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=640375.msg4315932#msg4315932 date=1371490149]

[quote author=Travas link=topic=640375.msg4315306#msg4315306 date=1371399853]

[quote author=Arcik link=topic=640375.msg4315271#msg4315271 date=1371395204]
I though windows only support up to 16gb anyway?
[/quote]nope. It can support A LOT. 32 bit supports very little physical memory and 64 bit supports a ton more (of course, older windows operating systems support less, but windows 8 nowadays supports a lot).
[/quote]I believe the max supported ram(without getting a server board…) is 64gb in windows 8?
[/quote]What does a server board have to do with anything, I am talking about windows 8 in general.

I suggest you look at this http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa366778(v=vs.85).aspx[/quote]a blade server can hold much more than windows 8 that’s what I am getting at. A regular consumer motherboard would only maximize out at 64gb at the current time ( correct me if I am wrong but I do not believe there is a 128gb motherboard for a regular OS…?)

When I worked for the county we had two xeon server boards holding somewhere between 1tb/maybe a little less of ram if I remember correctly. (it may had been half a 1tb can’t remember at the moment has been over two years… )

Just because you have a server board does not mean you have to use windows server 2012/whatever though either. For example: sk8er was asking in a thread a while back about replacing his blade server with a windows 7 os and he got the answers he were looking for on the windows 7 forums I believe. If you had a need for MORE ram than get a server board the motherboards currently out are not “up to date” with the maximized amount of memory that can be put on a computer.

Truth to be told though I wouldn’t be surprised one bit if the technology was out there for consumers and the companies just are “holding off” to make the most profit.

Read full topic

[/quote]I believe the max supported ram(without getting a server board…) is 64gb in windows 8?[/quote]What does a server board have to do with anything, I am talking about windows 8 in general.

[quote=“Travas, post:11, topic:521864”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=640375.msg4315271#msg4315271 date=1371395204]
I though windows only support up to 16gb anyway?
[/quote]nope. It can support A LOT. 32 bit supports very little physical memory and 64 bit supports a ton more (of course, older windows operating systems support less, but windows 8 nowadays supports a lot).[/quote]I believe the max supported ram(without getting a server board…) is 64gb in windows 8?

[hr]

[quote=“Krackkid, post:16, topic:521864”]I Just Bought An Apple Computer With Some Awesome Ram, My PhotoShop Runs Great Now! #Apple #Macbook #Air #Photoshop[/quote]yeah but apples can’t game

[hr]

Overall…You may need 8-16GB ram MAX and that’s only for the most extreme games.
